Comments_List: Good overview of IO methods and literature. Also good opportunity to think about research.

I developed knowledge of firm entry models and knowledge of a few papers that study specific markets with IO tools.  I developed skills of presentation.    Some of the comments on my presentation gave me insights that may help my current research project move forward.
This course completed the survey of the IO literature and focused on static entry models, multiple equilibria (set identification), and applications Prof. Berry had experience with.
A problem set would have been useful. Also, shorter student presentations (especially on the papers) to make time for more formal lectures.

This course was structured and taught well.  It does seem a little strange that we studied these relatively less complicated static entry models after everything we did in the first semester, not before.
Yes. Lectures in the first half and feedback on research are both very useful.
I would recommend this course.  The topics were interesting, the atmosphere of the course was pleasant, and I felt I experienced a high ratio of learning to effort expended.
